A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Only a true genius could write a prison break story\, where some prisoners leave the prison to find a locksmith who'll help them break into the control room to turn off the searchlights. 

Do they wear disguises or dig a tunnel? Haha\, not in this story. They just walk out the front gates. It's a complete success. Then they get arrested for parking in the wrong place.

Luckily they find a master locksmith in their cell. So it all works out. Such a multilayered plot. Incredible.

When they get back they find out that the prisoners had a better plan while they were gone. Sneak out in broad day light. Wearing cloaks of invisibility.

They are actually bed sheets with no concealing effect whatsoever. And nearly everyone gets shot. Nobody feels particularly sad about it.

Some other stuff happens\, but who cares?

If you can start watching a film half way through\, while eating a meal\, and still enjoy it\, you could enjoy this film. Forget the story that led up to this point\, because it no longer matters. The film makers do not think it is relevant and nor should you.
